questions.question_text: In the context of policies and permissions in AWS IAM, the Condition element is ____________.

choices.A: crucial while writing the IAM policies

questions.answer_description:
The Condition element (or Condition block) lets you specify conditions for when a policy is in effect. The Condition element is optional.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/AccessPolicyLanguage_ElementDescriptions.html

questions.question_text: Which of the following is true while using an IAM role to grant permissions to applications running on Amazon EC2 instances?

choices.C: Multiple roles are assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.
choices.B: All applications on the instance share multiple roles and permissions.
choices.D: Only one role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.
choices.A: All applications on the instance share the same role, but different permissions.

discussion.content: D. Only one role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.

Selected Answer: D
The correct option is D. Only one role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.

When using an IAM role to grant permissions to applications running on Amazon EC2 instances, only one IAM role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time. Each EC2 instance can be associated with a single IAM role, and all applications running on that instance will share the same role and have the same set of permissions granted by that role.

Option A is incorrect because although all applications on the instance share the same role, they have the same permissions, not different permissions.

Option B is incorrect because all applications on the instance share a single role, not multiple roles.

Option C is incorrect because only one role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.

Selected Answer: D
D. 
I hope one instance can be associated with multiple roles similar to the security groups.
D. Only one role can be assigned to an EC2 instance at a time.
sure D
Tested on Practice. agree with D

questions.answer_description:
Attempts, one of the three types of items associated with a schedule pipeline in AWS Data Pipeline, provides robust data management. AWS Data Pipeline retries a failed operation. It continues to do so until the task reaches the maximum number of allowed retry attempts. Attempt objects track the various attempts, results, and failure reasons if applicable. Essentially, it is the instance with a counter. AWS Data Pipeline performs retries using the same resources from the previous attempts, such as Amazon EMR clusters and EC2 instances.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/datapipeline/latest/DeveloperGuide/dp-how-tasks-scheduled.html

choices.D: AWS Data Pipeline Attempt objects track the various attempts, results, and failure reasons if applicable.
choices.B: AWS Data Pipeline retries a failed operation until the count of retries reaches the maximum number of allowed retry attempts.
choices.C: An AWS Data Pipeline Attempt object compiles the pipeline components to create a set of actionable instances.

questions.question_text:
Attempts, one of the three types of items associated with the schedule pipeline in the AWS Data Pipeline, provides robust data management.
Which of the following statements is NOT true about Attempts?

discussion.content: C. An AWS Data Pipeline Attempt object compiles the pipeline components to create a set of actionable instances.

Attempts, one of the three types of items associated with a schedule pipeline in AWS Data Pipeline, provides robust data management. AWS Data Pipeline retries a failed operation. It continues to do so until the task reaches the maximum number of allowed retry attempts. Attempt objects track the various attempts, results, and failure reasons if applicable. Essentially, it is the instance with a counter. AWS Data Pipeline performs retries using the same resources from the previous attempts, such as Amazon EMR clusters and EC2 instances.
C is correct
C. An AWS Data Pipeline Attempt object compiles the pipeline components to create a set of actionable instances.

Oh NOT true
It is C

Agree with C. 
Instances â€” When AWS Data Pipeline runs a pipeline, it compiles the pipeline components to create a set of actionable instances. Each instance contains all the information for performing a specific task. The complete set of instances is the to-do list of the pipeline. AWS Data Pipeline hands the instances out to task runners to process.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/datapipeline/latest/DeveloperGuide/dp-how-tasks-scheduled.html
Choose "NOT TRUE" one...so the answer is C.

choices.D: It cannot run in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) environment.
choices.C: It does not integrate with other Amazon Web Services.
choices.B: It allows you to quickly deploy your cache environment only if you install software.
choices.A: It makes it easy to set up, manage, and scale a distributed in-memory cache environment in the cloud.

questions.answer_description:
ElastiCache is a web service that makes it easy to set up, manage, and scale a distributed in memory cache environment in the cloud. It provides a high- performance, scalable, and cost- effective caching solution, while removing the complexity associated with deploying and managing a distributed cache environment. With ElastiCache, you can quickly deploy your cache environment, without having to provision hardware or install software.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/UserGuide/WhatIs.html
